info.description:
The Text Analytics API is a suite of text analytics web services built with best-in-class Microsoft machine learning algorithms. 
The API can be used to analyze unstructured text for tasks such as sentiment analysis, key phrase and entity extraction as well as language detection. 
No training data is needed to use this API; just bring your text data. 
This API uses advanced natural language processing techniques to deliver best in class predictions.

Further documentation can be found in https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/text-analytics/overview

This API is currently available in:

* Australia East - australiaeast.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* Brazil South - brazilsouth.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* Canada Central - canadacentral.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* Central India - centralindia.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* Central US - centralus.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* East Asia - eastasia.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* East US - eastus.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* East US 2 - eastus2.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* France Central - francecentral.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* Japan East - japaneast.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* Japan West - japanwest.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* Korea Central - koreacentral.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* North Central US - northcentralus.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* North Europe - northeurope.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* South Africa North - southafricanorth.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* South Central US - southcentralus.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* Southeast Asia - southeastasia.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* UK South - uksouth.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* West Central US - westcentralus.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* West Europe - westeurope.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* West US - westus.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
* West US 2 - westus2.api.cognitive.microsoft.com
info.title: Text Analytics API

post.description: The API returns a list of general named entities in a given document. For the list of supported entity types, check Supported Entity Types in Text Analytics API. For the list of enabled languages, check Supported languages in Text Analytics API.

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: (optional) This value indicates which model will be used for scoring. If a model-version is not specified, the API should default to the latest, non-preview version.

parameters.name: showStats
parameters.description: (optional) if set to true, response will contain input and document level statistics.

parameters.name: multiLanguageBatchInput
parameters.description: Collection of documents to analyze.

200.description: A successful call results in a list of recognized entities returned for each valid document.

post.description: The API returns a list of healthcare entities in a given document. See the Supported languages in Text Analytics API for the list of enabled languages.

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: (optional) This value indicates which model will be used for scoring. If a model version is not specified, the API should default to the latest, non-preview version.

parameters.name: showStats
parameters.description: (optional) if set to true, response will contain input and document level statistics.

parameters.name: multiLanguageBatchInput
parameters.description: Collection of documents to analyze.

200.description: A successful call results in a list of recognized entities returned for each valid document

post.summary: Entities from Personally Identifiable Information (PII) domain
post.description: The API returns a list of personally identifiable information (PII) entities (\"SSN\", \"Bank Account\" etc) in the document. See the <a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/text-analytics/text-analytics-supported-languages">Supported languages in Text Analytics API</a> for the list of enabled languages.

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: (optional) This value indicates which model will be used for scoring. If a model-version is not specified, the API should default to the latest, non-preview version.

parameters.name: showStats
parameters.description: (optional) if set to true, response will contain input and document level statistics.

parameters.name: multiLanguageBatchInput
parameters.description: Collection of documents to analyze.

200.description: A successful call results in a list of recognized entities returned for each valid document

post.summary: Linked entities from a well-known knowledge base
post.description: The API returns a list of recognized entities with links to a well-known knowledge base. See the <a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/text-analytics/text-analytics-supported-languages">Supported languages in Text Analytics API.

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: (optional) This value indicates which model will be used for scoring. If a model-version is not specified, the API should default to the latest, non-preview version.

parameters.name: showStats
parameters.description: (optional) if set to true, response will contain input and document level statistics.

parameters.name: multiLanguageBatchInput
parameters.description: Collection of documents to analyze.

200.description: A successful call results in a list of recognized entities returned for each valid document

post.description: The API returns a list of strings denoting the key phrases in the input text. See the <a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/text-analytics/text-analytics-supported-languages">Supported languages in Text Analytics API</a> for the list of enabled languages.

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: (optional) This value indicates which model will be used for scoring. If a model-version is not specified, the API should default to the latest, non-preview version.

parameters.name: showStats
parameters.description: (optional) if set to true, response will contain input and document level statistics.

parameters.name: multiLanguageBatchInput
parameters.description: Collection of documents to analyze. Documents can now contain a language field to indicate the text language

200.description: A successful response results in 0 or more key phrases identified in each valid document

post.description: The API returns the detected language and a numeric score between 0 and 1. Scores close to 1 indicate 100% certainty that the identified language is true. A total of 120 languages are supported.

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: (optional) This value indicates which model will be used for scoring. If a model-version is not specified, the API should default to the latest, non-preview version.

parameters.name: showStats
parameters.description: (optional) if set to true, response will contain input and document level statistics.

parameters.name: languageBatchInput
parameters.description: Collection of documents to analyze.

200.description: A successful call results in the detected language with the highest probability for each valid document

post.description: The API returns a sentiment prediction, as well as sentiment scores for each sentiment class (Positive, Negative, and Neutral) for the document and each sentence within it. See the <a href="https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/azure/cognitive-services/text-analytics/text-analytics-supported-languages">Supported languages in Text Analytics API</a> for the list of enabled languages.

parameters.name: modelVersion
parameters.description: (optional) This value indicates which model will be used for scoring. If a model-version is not specified, the API should default to the latest, non-preview version.

parameters.name: showStats
parameters.description: (optional) if set to true, response will contain input and document level statistics.

parameters.name: multiLanguageBatchInput
parameters.description: Collection of documents to analyze.

200.description: A successful call results in a document sentiment prediction, as well as sentiment scores for each sentiment class (Positive, Negative, and Neutral)

documents.description: The set of documents to process as part of this batch.

MultiLanguageBatchInput.description: Contains a set of input documents to be analyzed by the service.

documents.text: Hello world. This is some input text that I love.
It's sunny outside! I'm so happy.
Pike place market is my favorite Seattle attraction.

language.description: (Optional) This is the 2 letter ISO 639-1 representation of a language. For example, use "en" for English; "es" for Spanish etc. If not set, use "en" for English as default.

MultiLanguageInput.description: Contains an input document to be analyzed by the service.

details.description: (Optional) Details about specific errors that led to this reported error.

modelVersion.description: (Optional) if modelVersion=true was specified in the request this field will indicate which model is used for scoring.

sentiment.description: Predicted sentiment for document (Negative, Neutral, Positive, or Mixed).

documentScores.description: Document level sentiment confidence scores for each sentiment class.

documentsCount.description: Number of documents submitted in the request.

validDocumentsCount.description: Number of valid documents. This excludes empty, over-size limit or non-supported languages documents.

erroneousDocumentsCount.description: Number of invalid documents. This includes empty, over-size limit or non-supported languages documents.

transactionsCount.description: Number of transactions for the request.

RequestStatistics.description: (Optional) if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the request payload.

charactersCount.description: Number of text elements recognized in the document.

transactionsCount.description: Number of transactions for the document.

DocumentStatistics.description: (Optional) if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the document payload.

SentimentConfidenceScorePerLabel.description: Represents the confidence scores across all sentiment classes: positive, neutral, negative.

sentiment.description: The predicted Sentiment for the sentence.

sentenceScores.description: The sentiment confidence score for the sentence for all classes.

offset.description: The sentence offset from the start of the document.

length.description: The length of the sentence by Unicode standard.

warnings.description: The warnings generated for the sentence.

modelVersion.description: (Optional) if modelVersion=true was specified in the request this field will indicate which model is used for scoring.

statistics.description: (Optional) if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the document payload.

text.description: Entity text as appears in the request.

type.description: Entity type, such as Person/Location/Org/SSN etc

subType.description: (Optional) Entity sub type, such as Age/Year/TimeRange etc

offset.description: Start position (in Unicode characters) for the entity text.

length.description: Length (in Unicode characters) for the entity text.

score.description: Confidence score of the extracted entity.

modelVersion.description: (Optional) if modelVersion=true was specified in the request this field will indicate which model is used for scoring.

entities.description: Recognized healthcare entities in the document.

relations.description: (Optional) Relations of recognized healthcare entities in the document.

statistics.description: (Optional) if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the document payload.

text.description: Entity text as appears in the request.

id.description: Unique Id of the entity (used for matching between relation and entity results).

type.description: Entity type, such as DOSAGE/FREQUENCY etc.

offset.description: Start position (in Unicode characters) for the entity text.

length.description: Length (in Unicode characters) for the entity text.

score.description: Confidence score of the extracted entity.

umlsId.description: (Optional) Id from the Unified Medical Language System (UMLS).

category.description: (Optional) Entity category, such as MEDICATION etc -- (TBD).

relationType.description: Relation types of the related entities, such as DOSAGE_OF_MEDICATION/TIME_OF_MEDICATION etc.

id.description: Unique Id of the entity (used for matching between relation and entity results).

modelVersion.description: (Optional) if modelVersion=true was specified in the request this field will indicate which model is used for scoring.

entities.description: Recognized well-known entities in the document.

statistics.description: (Optional) if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the document payload.

matches.description: List of instances this entity appears in the text.

language.description: Language used in the data source.

id.description: Unique identifier of the recognized entity from the data source.

url.description: URL for the entity's page from the data source.

dataSource.description: Data source used to extract entity linking, such as Wiki/Bing etc.

score.description: (optional) If a well-known item is recognized, a decimal number denoting the confidence level will be returned.

text.description: Entity text as appears in the request.

offset.description: Start position (in Unicode characters) for the entity match text.

length.description: Length (in Unicode characters) for the entity match text.

modelVersion.description: (Optional) if modelVersion=true was specified in the request this field will indicate which model is used for scoring.

keyPhrases.description: A list of representative words or phrases. The number of key phrases returned is proportional to the number of words in the input document.

statistics.description: (Optional) if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the document payload.

documents.text: La carretera estaba atascada. Había mucho tráfico el día de ayer.

modelVersion.description: (Optional) if modelVersion=true was specified in the request this field will indicate which model is used for scoring.

statistics.description: (Optional) if showStats=true was specified in the request this field will contain information about the document payload.

name.description: Long name of a detected language (e.g. English, French).

iso6391Name.description: A two letter representation of the detected language according to the ISO 639-1 standard (e.g. en, fr).

score.description: A confidence score between 0 and 1. Scores close to 1 indicate 100% certainty that the identified language is true.

Endpoint.name: Endpoint
Endpoint.description: Supported Cognitive Services endpoints (protocol and hostname, for example: https://westus.api.cognitive.microsoft.com).
